rev.comment: the text suggested it was ZDnet who initially found the bug, slight tweak
rev.diff:
Line 92: Line 92:
===Volume bug===
===Volume bug===
â
+
A few days after the UK release, some users started noticing a glitch in the volume control, where the phone would lower the volume by itself,<ref name=Zbug>{{cite web|last=Woods|first=Ben|title=Samsung stays silent over Galaxy Nexus volume glitch|url=http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/samsung-stays-silent-over-galaxy-nexus-volume-glitch-10024853/|work=11-22-2011|publisher=Zdnet|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref><ref name=WPbug>{{cite news|last=Tsukayama|first=Hayley|title=Galaxy Nexus hit with volume bug in Britain|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/technology/galaxy-nexus-hit-with-volume-bug-in-britain/2011/11/21/gIQAuLG2hN_story.html?tid=pm_business_pop|accessdate=22 November 2011|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=11-22-2011}}</ref> [[Cnet|Cnet UK]] also reported that the phone in their review "dropped the volume when we were using 2G. This means it was almost impossible to make calls over 2G. We missed calls and texts due to not hearing alerts."<ref name=Cnetreview>{{cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review|url=http://reviews.cnet.co.uk/mobile-phones/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review-50005755/|publisher=Cnet (UK)|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>. The issue was acknowledged by [[O2]] who noted that they were unable to offer a solution at the momment, but confirmed that both Google and Samsung are aware of the issue<ref name=DSbug>{{cite web|last=Laughlin|first=Andrew|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus users report crippling volume bug|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tech/news/a352228/samsung-galaxy-nexus-users-report-crippling-volume-bug.html|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref> On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] temporarily stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices. The company noted that "the tests are showing when in 2G mode the volume is acting erratically".<ref>http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/</ref><ref name=Vergebug>{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
â
In its review of 22 November 2011, [[Cnet|Cnet UK]] recommended that UK customers did not buy the phone yet because of a reported bug that "dropped the volume when we were using 2G. This means it was almost impossible to make calls over 2G. We missed calls and texts due to not hearing alerts."<ref name=Cnetreview>{{cite web|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus review|url=http://reviews.cnet.co.uk/mobile-phones/samsung-galaxy-nexus-review-50005755/|publisher=Cnet (UK)|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>. This bug was reported by a number of users<ref name=Zbug>{{cite web|last=Woods|first=Ben|title=Samsung stays silent over Galaxy Nexus volume glitch|url=http://www.zdnet.co.uk/blogs/tech-tech-boom-10017860/samsung-stays-silent-over-galaxy-nexus-volume-glitch-10024853/|work=11-22-2011|publisher=Zdnet|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref><ref name=WPbug>{{cite news|last=Tsukayama|first=Hayley|title=Galaxy Nexus hit with volume bug in Britain|url=http://www.washingtonpost.com/business/technology/galaxy-nexus-hit-with-volume-bug-in-britain/2011/11/21/gIQAuLG2hN_story.html?tid=pm_business_pop|accessdate=22 November 2011|newspaper=The Washington Post|date=11-22-2011}}</ref> and acknowledged by [[O2]] who noted that they were unable to offer a solution.<ref name=DSbug>{{cite web|last=Laughlin|first=Andrew|title=Samsung Galaxy Nexus users report crippling volume bug|url=http://www.digitalspy.co.uk/tech/news/a352228/samsung-galaxy-nexus-users-report-crippling-volume-bug.html|publisher=Digital Spy|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref> On the 22 November 2011, the UK retailer [[Handtec]] stopped Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming that there was a problem with its stock of devices. The company noted that "the tests are showing when in 2G mode the volume is acting erratically".<ref>http://www.handtec.co.uk/blog/2011/11/samsung-galaxy-nexus-shipping-update/</ref><ref name=Vergebug>{{cite web|last=Ziegler|first=Chris|title=Retailer Handtec stops Galaxy Nexus shipments after confirming volume bug|url=http://www.theverge.com/2011/11/22/2580432/retailer-handtec-stops-galaxy-nexus-shipments-after-confirming-volume|work=11-22-2011|publisher=The Verge|accessdate=22 November 2011}}</ref>
